headline.main: 2,000 Attend Teach-In On Breast Cancer; 2,000 Attend Teach-In on Breast Cancer

docs.abstract: 2,000 women attend American Cancer Society breast cancer teach-in, NYC, preceding medical conference on subject; American Health Foundation pres Dr Ernst L Wynder urges women to cut fat consumption to help prevent disease; Dr Arthur L Holleb notes over 90% of growths are detected by women themselves; Drs Benjamin F Byrd, James Holland and Reuven K Snyderman describe surgical and post-mastectomy procedures (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: ONE of every 13 women now alive in the United States will develop breast cancer at some time in the future. That grim statistic was repeated over and over to the 2,000 women attending a "national breast cancer teach-in" yesterday at the Waldorf-Astoria Hotel.
